title: Is it just me or are AP junglers crazy under powered this season?
body: I'm a jungle main since season 5 and I got to say that AP junglers feel like they are so underpowered this season that its dumb to pick them.  {{champion:76}}  {{champion:60}}  {{champion:79}}  {{champion:9}} {{champion:28}}  etc.. all have win rates  way under 50%. This has to do with the new jungle camps being more difficult to clear and {{item:1402}} {{item:1414}} {{item:1410}}  being so under powered. AD junglers are also way more effective early in the game, especially that games rarely go over 30 minutes, and abuse CoC like crazy. Only AP jungler that is good right now is {{champion:427}}  but hes getting nerfed every patch since his release and he is more like a support. What do you guys think? I think a {{item:1402}}  buff or individual buffs to those champs might make it more diverse in the pick process,not that I dont like {{champion:120}}  or {{champion:254}}  or {{champion:64}}  but i think its time to see some changes.

All of those either go cinderhulk competitively or just go full tank after 2 items tops.

The jungler role itself was meant to be for bruisers and assassins...

{{champion:60}} is the only good ap jungler imo, she clears fast and has high sustain and good ganks, shes great if you have a AD team but its honestly just better to pick {{champion:107}} {{champion:121}} or {{champion:64}}
AP junglers not named Nidalee or Elise have pretty much been bad for like 3 seasons, now.
But after the elise buff in like what last season? she's been hardly touched for nerfs, so it's more of a meta shift that's hurting her over her actual level
It is not just you, riot said they were underpowered in an article.

If you're referring to [the recent jungler execution data article](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/executed-terrible-truth-about-jungle-monsters), they said they were _in Season 6_. Not now. They haven't said anything about AP junglers being weak for Season 7 yet.

Like do you even think 'hey I'm only silver 3 on my main champ with only a little above a 50% win ratio.. maybe I've got no idea whatsoever how to play this game as even on much best champ and I'm my best role I still can't  consistently beat the most bang average players.'

{{champion:154}} ?
He does magic damage, but if that makes him an AP jungler then {{champion:113}} {{champion:20}} {{champion:427}} {{champion:79}} {{champion:32}} are also AP junglers, and not "tank" or "support"
oh Zac is a tank? Couldn't tell by how he deletes my ADC if he ever so slightly gets ahead.
Oh really you didn't notice the bit where his kit is focused on initiation and durability through sustain?
this was obviously sarcasm guys lol, hes just stating a problem that zac has a bit too much damage. He can just jump in a fight and ult to kill a squishy as if he is a diver/juggernaut.

I wasn't serious.. >.>

I'm pointing out he does more than just that though ;).
They are AP junglers. Building tank or support does not change the fact that they primarily scale off of AP. Also, full AP versions of these are terrifying.

nobody knows what to copy when the pros are playing alien vs predator.... and lee sin
When this post is made. 3 hours after a rioter posts the amount of jungle executions per champ, with ap junglers having the highest percentage of executes in the game out of all junglers

blue buff doesn't offer ap.  Red still offers its burn debuff which is pretty useless of most ap junglers.  Typically AP junglers have a harder time with high enemy camps because they don't offer a lot in the way of reliable aoe clear that isn't mana intensive.

The problem is the meta right now and the jungle clearing.  Assassins and ad champs with good wave clear can usually clear the jungle before they need to back while most ap junglers can only do about half the jungle before backing.  This puts them farther behind when they need to provide pressure early otherwise they snowball downward and won't catch up.
I dont thin eve is underpowered, its just they don't go against the current meta well. Builds/champs seem to just counter them better
Eve is the least bad of these because of how her Q works and also her invisibility to gank. And she does have a 48% wr rn
48% seems reasonable for a champion that difficult to execute with.

I would like to argue that the only AP Jg's really being shafted right now are {{champion:9}} , {{champion:76}} , {{champion:10}} , {{champion:105}}  and {{champion:245}}.

Kayle requires too long to get the core items she needs in order to start becoming a threat, and the Jg items don't directly help her in terms of reaching that point.  Ekko's early clears end up taking forever if he goes tank, but end up being extremely dangerous if he goes AP. Fizz has the same issue, except that not only does he not have good survivability in jg, but he cannot reliably gank until 6. This is also true with Kayle and Ekko to some extent considering how difficult it can be to judge how the enemy laner will react when W is placed. Fiddle cannot kite jg camps, and only has 1 damage ability that isn't a channel, and Nid is so heavily based on single target elimination that camps like raptors and krugs screw her entire clear over. If she needs to heal, she must go into her human form, which has no AOE abilities, hindering her clear. Not to mention that Nid requires a tanky item in order to dive in now, which she can't really achieve until around 20 minutes.

Champions {{champion:28}} , {{champion:79}}  and {{champion:60}}  have lower winrates because they are simply more skill based than the other AP jg's, can influence the game negatively with an ultimate, require knowledge on the players part on what they need to do, or just played completely wrong.  {{champion:79}} suffers from the 2nd and 3rd point, Elise suffers from the 1st and 3rd point, and Eve Suffers from the 3rd point.
Every other AP in the game other than the ones I mentioned at the top don't really have much of a problem.

doing krugs is pointless on nidalee bcs you can do 5 camp you stay on 80% hp and take a scuttle for a lvl 4 and you are ready to tank a lane she is not the easiest champion to play but if you know how to play her you will never have a bad game on her
her 43% winrate says otherwise

Everyone but Gragas is great this season. Gragas has suffered a little. He is still viable but I would pick some of the others over him currently. I believe they are pretty good as long as you keep aware and farm up the best you can.
Fiddle is nearly unplayable as jungle currently.

This is pretty funny considering Nidalee and Gragas and to a lesser extent Elise have had HUGE crowding out problems in the past. The moment they're performing below 51% win percentage and they're not instalocked in pro play, people say "What happened to them?"

Hm, I would say  that Fid, Eve and Gragas are still quite good.
Lux and Kat are still solid junglers, too. You just need to avoid dying stupid deaths, and mind your positioning. 
Every champ is a good jungler, as lon as you're good enough.

Most AP Junglers don't have consistent healing or AOE and those that do have massive mana problems.  Fiddlesticks actually has an ok clear if you max E second however clearing your jg literally uses all of your mana and I've been forced to put full mastery points into meditation to make him work.
